latest.title: Strategic Update and Business Expansion
latest.content:
27 Jan 2026 16:00
RNS Number : 6002Q
Sealand Capital Galaxy Limited
27 January 2026
THE INFORMATION CONTAINED WITHIN THIS ANNOUNCEMENT IS DEEMED BY THE COMPANY TO CONSTITUTE INSIDE INFORMATION AS STIPULATED UNDER THE MARKET ABUSE REGULATION (EU) NO. 596/2014, AS AMENDED WHICH, BY VIRTUE OF THE EUROPEAN UNION (WITHDRAWAL) ACT 2018, FORMS PART OF UK LAW. ON THE PUBLICATION OF THIS ANNOUNCEMENT VIA A REGULATORY INFORMATION SERVICE ("RIS"), THIS INSIDE INFORMATION IS NOW CONSIDERED TO BE IN THE PUBLIC DOMAIN.
Sealand Capital Galaxy Limited
("Sealand" or the "Company")
Strategic
Update
and Business Expansion
The Board of Sealand (LSE: SCGL) is pleased to announce its intention to
enhance
the Company's strategic objectives and core business operations. The Board believes that focusing the Company's resources on high-growth technology and AI-led opportunities is the best route to enhance long-term shareholder value. Following a review of market trends and the Company's capabilities, the Board intends to
upgrade
and augment the Company's developmental priorities (the "Expansion").
Strategic focus: technology and AI
Under the intended Expansion, the Company plans to prioritise:
·
AI and SaaS software tools to support commercial deployment of digital management solutions; and
·
Computing-power infrastructure and energy technology, with the aim of building a more integrated platform spanning digitalisation, intelligence, computing support and energy assurance.
The Board believes this renewed focus will strengthen the Company's competitiveness and support sustainable revenue generation over time.
Geographic focus: Asia-Pacific
The Company intends to prioritise the Asia-Pacific region through a dual-hub approach:
·
Shenzhen as the hub for Mainland China operations (Greater Bay Area); and
·
Hong Kong as a base for expansion into Southeast Asia and broader Asian markets.
Supporting activities
To support the execution of the Expansion, the Company aims to:
·
provide advisory services to international companies entering China and the UK market; and
·
pursue selective investments aligned with the Company's technology and AI strategy where the Board considers these accelerate delivery of the intended priorities.
Governance and implementation
The Board intends to ensure it has an appropriate mix of skills and experience to oversee the Company's intended technological and infrastructure priorities and may evaluate synergistic M&A opportunities consistent with the Expansion.
All actions will be undertaken in accordance with applicable UK regulatory requirements, including the UK Listing Rules and the Disclosure Guidance and Transparency Rules. The Company will provide further updates as appropriate.
For the avoidance of doubt, this announcement sets out the Company's intended strategic direction only and does not constitute a profit forecast or investment commitment.
The Directors of the Company are responsible for the release of this announcement.
Enquiries:
Sealand Capital Galaxy Limited
Dr. Thomas Sawyer (Chief Executive Officer)
Mr. Siqi Cao (Executive Director)
Bowsprit Partners Limited (Financial Adviser)

latest.title: Director Appointment and CFO Appointment
latest.content:
Today 16:00
RNS Number : 8382P
Sealand Capital Galaxy Limited
21 January 2026
THE INFORMATION CONTAINED WITHIN THIS ANNOUNCEMENT IS DEEMED BY THE COMPANY TO CONSTITUTE INSIDE INFORMATION AS STIPULATED UNDER THE MARKET ABUSE REGULATION (EU) NO. 596/2014, AS AMENDED WHICH, BY VIRTUE OF THE EUROPEAN UNION (WITHDRAWAL) ACT 2018, FORMS PART OF UK LAW. ON THE PUBLICATION OF THIS ANNOUNCEMENT VIA A REGULATORY INFORMATION SERVICE ("RIS"), THIS INSIDE INFORMATION IS NOW CONSIDERED TO BE IN THE PUBLIC DOMAIN.
SEALAND CAPITAL GALAXY LIMITED
("Sealand"
or the
"Company")
Director Appointment and CFO Appointment
Sealand Capital Galaxy Limited (LSE: SCGL), is pleased to announce the appointment of Mr Sunny Terng to the Board as an Independent Non-Executive Director, with immediate effect. The Company further announces that it has appointed Mr Peng Liu (Patrick) as Chief Financial Officer, with immediate effect.
Chong Sun Terng - Independent Non-Executive Director, Audit Committee Chair
Mr. Chong Sun Terng (aged 35) is a finance and investment banking professional with over 10 years' experience across audit, advisory and capital markets, with a focus on cross-border transactions and capital raising. His experience spans China, Hong Kong, Malaysia and the UK, covering M&A, strategic investment execution, IPO advisory and financial and compliance advisory.
Mr. Terng is currently Executive Director, Investment Banking at Fernwin Capital (Shenzhen) Co., Ltd. (April 2023 to present), working on cross-border M&A and capital raising transactions, strategic investments in NASDAQ listed companies and IPO advisory assignments.
Previously, he worked at GreenPro Capital Corp (Hong Kong) (Nasdaq: GRNQ) (January 2022 to March 2023) in a financial advisory and audit capacity. Earlier in his career, Mr. Terng was Audit Manager at Kaizen CPA Limited (Hong Kong) (July 2019 to December 2021) and worked in audit in Malaysia.
The Company expects that Mr. Terng will serve as Chair of the Audit Committee.
In addition to his appointment at Sealand, Mr. Terng currently holds, or has held during the past five years, the following directorships:
Current directorships / partnerships
·
Executive Director - Fernwin Capital (Shenzen) Co., Ltd
Past directorships / partnerships (last five years)
·
None.
There is nothing further to disclose under LR 9.6.13R.
Peng Liu - Chief Financial Officer
Mr. Peng Liu (aged 33) is an experienced finance professional with a background spanning auditing, financial management and IPO advisory. He has worked on a range of audit and corporate finance assignments, including due diligence, equity investment support, M&A advisory work, internal control reviews and IPO planning, including cross-border listing and financing projects.
Mr. Liu is currently Vice President (IBD) at Shiyida Enterprise Management Consulting (Shenzhen) Co., Ltd. (October 2024 to present), where he oversees domestic and overseas listing and financing projects, including project screening and evaluation, due diligence, overseas IPO planning, compliance initiatives, pre-IPO financing, restructuring and financial advisory work, including designing and implementing red-chip structures.
Prior to this, he was Associate Manager at Dahua Certified Public Accountants (Shenzhen) (February 2023 to October 2024), leading audit and advisory projects including annual audits, internal control audits and risk and compliance testing. He previously worked as an Auditor at Shinewing Certified Public Accountants (Shenzhen) (October 2021 to February 2023).
Mr. Liu holds an MSc in Accounting and Finance from the University of Leeds (UK) and a BSc in Accounting from the University of Tulsa (USA). He is fluent in English and Chinese and has experience across IFRS, US GAAP and Chinese Accounting Standards (CAS).
Dr Thomas Sawyer, CEO of Sealand, commented:
"I am delighted to welcome Mr. Terng to the Board and to appoint Mr. Liu as our Chief Financial Officer. Mr. Terng brings valuable cross-border capital markets and audit experience that will strengthen our governance, particularly through his chairing of the Audit Committee. Mr. Liu's financial management and IPO advisory expertise will enhance our finance function as we continue to execute our strategy."
-Ends-

THE INFORMATION CONTAINED WITHIN THIS ANNOUNCEMENT IS DEEMED BY THE COMPANY TO CONSTITUTE INSIDE INFORMATION AS STIPULATED UNDER THE MARKET ABUSE REGULATION (EU) NO. 596/2014, AS AMENDED, WHICH BY VIRTUE OF THE EUROPEAN UNION (WITHDRAWAL) ACT 2018 FORMS PART OF UK LAW. Sealand Capital Galaxy Limited
("
Sealand
" or the "
Company
")
Director Appointment
Sealand Capital Galaxy Limited announces the appointment of Mr Siqi Cao to the Board as Executive Director with immediate effect.
Mr. Cao, aged 44, is a seasoned entrepreneur and executive equipped with a Doctor of Business Administration and an MBA from EU Business School, as well as a Bachelor's Degree in Business Administration from the University of Toronto. Currently serving as Chief Executive Officer of Fern Win Capital, he previously founded Shengshi Jiahe
Group
. His current directorship includes a role at Glitter Connect Group Limited, a wholly owned subsidiary of Sealand Capital
Galaxy
, and he also held a board position at Top KingWin Ltd within the past five years.
Current directorships
·
Glitter Connect Group Limited (April 2025 - present)
Directorships held within the previous 5 years
·
Top KingWin Ltd (July 2022 - September 2024)
In accordance with LR 9.6.13R there is no further information to be disclosed.
Commenting on the appointment, Dr Thomas Sawyer, Chief Executive Officer, said:
"We are delighted to welcome Mr Cao to the Board of Sealand Capital Galaxy. His deep experience in capital markets, corporate management and strategic investment across multiple sectors will add tremendous value as we enter our next phase of growth. With sharp strategic acumen and profound industry insights, Mr. Cao will be supporting Sealand Capital Galaxy's business development initiatives and contributing robustly to the company's next phase of growth as a key member of its leadership team."

latest.title: Publication of a Prospectus
latest.content:
7 Nov 2025 12:05
RNS Number : 7144G
Sealand Capital Galaxy Limited
07 November 2025
THE INFORMATION CONTAINED WITHIN THIS ANNOUNCEMENT IS DEEMED BY THE COMPANY TO CONSTITUTE INSIDE INFORMATION AS STIPULATED UNDER THE MARKET ABUSE REGULATION (EU) NO. 596/2014, AS AMENDED, WHICH BY VIRTUE OF THE EUROPEAN UNION (WITHDRAWAL) ACT 2018 FORMS PART OF UK LAW. ON THE PUBLICATION OF THIS ANNOUNCEMENT VIA A REGULATORY INFORMATION SERVICE, THIS INSIDE INFORMATION IS NOW CONSIDERED TO BE IN THE PUBLIC DOMAIN.
Sealand Capital Galaxy Limited
("
Sealand
" or the "
Company
")
Publication of a Prospectus
Sealand Capital Galaxy Limited [LSE: SCGL], an IT, Social Media and Technology company focused on consolidating compelling opportunities in the global marketplace, announces that the Financial Conduct Authority has approved a prospectus dated 7 November 2025 (the "Prospectus").
The Prospectus relates to the admission of 113,628,767 ordinary shares of £0.0001 each to the Equity Shares (Transition) category of the Official List of the Financial Conduct Authority and to trading on the London Stock Exchange's main market for listed securities. Admission of the relevant securities is expected to occur at 8:00am on 12 November 2025 ("Admission"). Dealings are expected to commence at the same time.
The full Prospectus is available on the Company's website at
www.sealandcapitalgalaxy.com
and will be submitted to the Financial Conduct Authority's National Storage Mechanism, where it will be available for inspection at
https://data.fca.org.uk/#/nsm/nationalstoragemechanism
.
Following Admission, the Company's issued share capital will comprise 1,011,534,756 ordinary shares of £0.0001 each, each carrying one vote. The Company does not hold any shares in treasury. The total voting rights figure of 1,011,534,756 may be used by shareholders for the purposes of the FCA's Disclosure Guidance and Transparency Rules.
The Board believes the publication of the Prospectus and Admission will provide improved access to capital to support the Company's growth plans as it continues to progress its strategic objectives.
-Ends-

Sealand Capital Galaxy Limited

company_30s.what_they_do: SCGL is a micro‑cap listed on AIM with no publicly disclosed product or revenue stream.
company_30s.why_they_matter: It appears to be a speculative vehicle that could be used for capital raising or as a vehicle for insider trading, but it offers no clear market relevance.
company_30s.current_state: The company is in a pre‑revenue, struggling phase with its share price collapsed to essentially zero.

rns_narrative: Leadership reshuffle: on 21 January 2026 the board added a new director and a CFO, signalling an attempt to shore up governance.
Strategic update: 27 January 2026 the company issued a brief statement about business expansion, but no details on product, customers or revenue were provided.
Financial disclosure: the 30 April 2025 year‑end and 30 September 2025 half‑year reports were filed, yet they contain no revenue figures or growth metrics.

crowd_tape.dominant_theme: The community is largely silent; there is no visible enthusiasm or concern because the story offers no substance to discuss.
crowd_tape.bull_narrative: There is effectively no bull narrative beyond the hope that a new director or CFO might spark a turnaround.
crowd_tape.bear_narrative: Bears point to the lack of any product, revenue or clear strategy and the fact that the share price has fallen to zero.
crowd_tape.sentiment_shift: The sentiment has remained flat; there was no surge of optimism or fear in the weeks following the latest announcements.

whats_happening_now.attention_check: Google Trends shows a flat line with an interest score of 0/100, and no ShareChat posts were captured. The story has lost all oxygen; there is no search or social buzz to support a narrative.

near_term_catalysts: Q3 results (October 2026): the company could deliver a first revenue print, which would be the single event that could revive the share price.
AGM (December 2026): shareholders will vote on any new strategic plan or funding round that could inject capital.
expect_next.watch_for: Keep an eye on any mention of a product launch, a new customer contract, or a funding announcement. Also watch for director or insider selling, which could signal a lack of confidence.
expect_next.timing_regime: Exhausted – the story has been alive for months without any substantive development, so the window for a meaningful turnaround is essentially closed.

buy_vs_sell.bull_case: A sudden product launch or a surprise funding round could lift the price, but such an event would need to be clearly communicated and would have to overcome the current zero‑price base.
buy_vs_sell.bear_case: SCGL has no product, no revenue, and the share price has collapsed to zero. The recent announcements are governance moves, not growth signals, and there is no market demand or investor enthusiasm.
buy_vs_sell.risk_reward: The risk is extremely high while the reward is negligible; the price is unlikely to recover without a fundamental shift.

playbook.if_bullish: Do not take a position. The price is at zero and there is no realistic path to a meaningful upside.
playbook.if_watching: Remain out until a clear revenue or funding event is announced. Even then, consider a cautious entry on a dip with a tight stop below the current price.
playbook.if_passing: The story is dead. Allocate capital to micro‑caps that have a product, revenue or a clear growth narrative.

ai_insights.bottom_line: Pass – SCGL is a dead‑end speculative vehicle with no product, no revenue, no buzz, and a collapsed price; there is no realistic catalyst to justify a position.
